summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Michael Reiter, commanding him to appear before the grand jury on October 31, 2019, to testify and produce documents related to the criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and his associates from approximately 2005 to 2007. The subpoena is accompanied by a cover letter requesting confidentiality and an advice of rights form.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Michael Reiter
persons.context: Commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The criminal investigation referenced in the subpoena is focused on him and his associates.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a legal command (subpoena) to Reiter to appear and produce evidence.
Reiter is being subpoenaed to provide testimony and documents related to the criminal investigation of Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance of Michael Reiter
events.description: Michael Reiter is commanded to appear before the federal grand jury in New York to testify and provide evidence.

events.title: Period Under Investigation
events.description: The subpoena seeks documents relating to the criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and his associates from approximately 2005 up to and including 2007.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
keyFacts: A federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and his associates as of October 2019.

The investigation focused on potential violations of federal statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421 (transportation for prostitution), 2422 (coercion and enticement), 2423 (transportation of minors), and 371 (conspiracy).
Michael Reiter was subpoenaed to produce all documents in his possession related to the Epstein investigation from about 2005 to 2007.
The U.S. Attorney's office requested that the recipient voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.
The subpoena includes an 'Advice of Rights' form informing the recipient of their right against self-incrimination and right to counsel.
